gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Outstanding Rivers Listed by the Natural Resource Commission: Indiana, 2004

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Natural Resources Commission (creator); Bernardin-Lochmueller and Associates (compiler)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: RIVERS_OUTSTANDING_NRC_IN represents river and stream segments on the NRCs Outstanding Rivers list for Indiana. The source data was last updated in October 1997. Stream segments were obtained from 1:100K National Hydrography Dataset. The following was excerpted from the website for the Natural Resources Commission: In 1993, the Natural Resources Commission adopted its Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana. The listing was published in the Indiana Register on March 1 of that year as Information Bulletin #4 in Volume 16, Number 6, page 1677 through 1680 (sometimes cited as 16 IR 1677). The listing has also been specifically incorporated by reference into statutes and rules. Notably, the listing is referenced in the standards for utility line crossings within floodways, formerly governed by IC 14-28-2 and now controlled by 310 IAC 6-1-16 through 310 IAC 6-1-18. See, also, the general permit for logjam removals, implemented as an emergency rule and pending for adoption as a permanent rule at 310 IAC 6-1-20. Except where incorporated into a statute or rule, the listing is intended to provide guidance rather than to have regulatory application. A special listing was prepared by the division of outdoor recreation of the department of natural resources. The listing is a corrected and condensed version of a listing complied by American Rivers and dated October 1990. There are about 2,000 river miles included on the listing, a figure which represents less than 9% of the estimated 24,000 total river miles in Indiana. The natural resources commission has adopted the listing as an official recognition of the resource values of these waters.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The following was excerpted from the website for the Natural Resources Commission: To help identify the rivers and streams which have particular environmental or aesthetic interest... Except where incorporated into a statute or rule, the listing is intended to provide guidance rather than to have regulatory application.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Data is from the Natural Resource Commission Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This data set was compiled by Bernardin-Lochmueller and Associates, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. CREDIT Natural Resource Commission, 1997, Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana

No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY The product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Bernardin-Lochmueller and Assoc. is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 1.69 MB

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The source list was last updated in October 1997, while the website where the list is found (http://www.in.gov/nrc/policy/outstand.html) was last updated in April 2003.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Consistent with that of the 1:100K National Hydrography Dataset. There are no known overlaps or line gaps. Each line segment ends at intersections.
All Stream segments in the NRC List of Indiana Outstanding Rivers and Streams are included. Stream segments begin and end as closely to the Described limits as the processor could determine.
Accurate to the published outstanding rivers list updated October 1997.
Horizontal position is dependent on the accuracy of the National Hydrography Dataset (1:100K).
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) was copied for use as the base line file. The Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana was used to select all listed river/stream segments. Occasionally, DRGs were used to identify stream segments within the NHD which had an incomplete name field. New fields were added to the original NHD information to the attribute designation categories, special designations, and navigable status.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.
All base information to identify stream segments and complete attributes.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: In 1993, the Natural Resources Commission adopted its "Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana." The listing was published in the Indiana Register on March 1 of that year as Information Bulletin #4 in Volume 16, Number 6, page 1677 through 1680 (sometimes cited as 16 IR 1677).

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Base file for river and stream lines

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: HYDROGRAPHY_LINE_NHD_IN: Streams, Rivers, Canals, and Ditches in Indiana (U.S. Geological Survey, 1:100000, Polygon Shapefile)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey & U.S. Environmental Protection Agency

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Data is from the 2002 NHD data set downloadable from: http://nhd.usgs.gov/index.html

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
